meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by atavism.
meanings.sent1: The atavistic behavior of the wild wolf reminded us of its ancient ancestors.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the atavistic traits in the ancient fossils.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the atavistic instincts of the modern cat trying to catch its own tail.
meanings.sent4: Her atavistic fear of the dark was like a shadow from the past haunting her present.
meanings.sent5: The atavistic urge to protect their territory was strong in the pack of wild dogs.

meanings.definition: Reverting to or suggesting the characteristics of a remote ancestor or primitive type.
meanings.sent1: The atavistic design of the tribal mask reflected the ancient traditions of the tribe.
meanings.sent2: The old house had an atavistic charm that reminded visitors of a bygone era.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the atavistic fashion trends making a comeback in modern times.
meanings.sent4: Her atavistic love for nature was like a deep connection to her primal roots.
meanings.sent5: The atavistic rituals of the ancient ceremony were performed with solemn reverence.
